other_tests.findings: Acute and healing myocardial injury with focal necrotic myocytes, C4d+ on immunohistochemical staining, and reparative inflammatory infiltrate consisting primarily of CD68+ macrophages with rare CD3+ T lymphocytes.
Mildly reduced left ventricular ejection fraction of 49% and left ventricular mid-to-apical hypokinesis, with normal right ventricular function. No significant myocardial edema detected.
Slight improvement in global ventricular function.
24-hour fractionated urinary metanephrine level was 830 Î¼g (normal range for women, 30 to 180).
An ellipsoid mass (3.6 cm by 3.2 cm by 3.6 cm) anterior to the superior pole of the right kidney, most consistent with pheochromocytoma.
